page.title: 01EAST OF TIVERTON
page.content: Our Domesday Block is situated in the {County of Devon,}containing the eastern outskirts of{Tiverton,}a town of about 15,000 inhabitants, and open countryside in the{Lowman Valley. There are two{residential suburbs dating generally from the 1960/70's. About half of each estate is devoted to rented{council housing,}the rest consisting of a number of private developments inhabited by {owner-occupiers.} Between the two estates lie the{main {road (A.373),}the{old railway line, the{River Lowman}and a small {industrial area. }A canal is nearby. Along the south of the block runs a ridge of{hills}rising to about 200 metres, overlooking the{flat valley. {Farmland}which covers about 3/4 of the area is devoted mainly to{grassland {for grazing.
